definition: to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over

to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine

sentences.english: But it still can not be reconciled, wings flutter up more strongly.
sentences.chinese: 但它还是不甘心，双翅更加有力地扑闪起来。

sentences.english: An awful flicker of doubt appeared in her eyes.
Her big eyes blinked with astonishment.
sentences.chinese: 她惊讶地扑闪着她那两只大眼睛。

sentences.english: She noticed the other bird moving back and forth on the edge of the cage.
sentences.chinese: 她注意到另一只鸟儿在笼边扑闪着翅旋了膀。

sentences.english: The little dragonfly fluttered its wings and flew off.
sentences.chinese: 小蜻蜓扑闪扑闪翅膀飞走了。

sentences.english: The little dragonfly fluttered its wings and flew off.
sentences.chinese: 小蜻蜓扑闪扑闪翅膀飞走了。

sentences.english: may your eyelids never flutter into the empty distance.
sentences.chinese: 但愿你的眼睑永远不为空旷的远方而扑闪。

definition: eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
to fan/to flap/to incite/to instigate (a strike etc)
whirling/spinning around and around/round and plump (e.g. of fruit)
